unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**
normalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of launches recently, offering consumers a diverse range of options. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Automotive Institute, Chennai, recently hosted a seminar dissecting emerging trends in EV technology following the launch of the "Vidyut Vahan," a new electric scooter from a local manufacturer.
normalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of launches recently, offering consumers a diverse range of options. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Automotive Institute, Chennai, recently hosted a seminar dissecting emerging trends in E V technology following the launch of the "Vidyut Vahan," a new electric scooter from a local manufacturer.

unnormalised: Mahindra unveiled its much-anticipated Scorpio-N variant in Mumbai, boasting enhanced safety features and a redesigned interior. This comes on the heels of Maruti Suzuki's launch of the Alto 800 CNG variant, aimed at budget-conscious buyers seeking fuel efficiency amidst rising petrol prices. The Alto 800 CNG boasts a mileage of 31 km/kg.
normalised: Mahindra unveiled its much-anticipated Scorpio-N variant in Mumbai, boasting enhanced safety features and a redesigned interior. This comes on the heels of Maruti Suzuki's launch of the Alto eight hundred C N G variant, aimed at budget-conscious buyers seeking fuel efficiency amidst rising petrol prices. The Alto eight hundred C N G boasts a mileage of thirty one kilometer per kilogram.

unnormalised: Industry analysts are noting a shift towards SUVs and crossovers, reflecting a preference for larger vehicles capable of handling diverse terrains. Tata Motors recently showcased a concept for a micro-SUV in Pune, indicating future design direction. Prices for new vehicles range from Rs. 4 lakhs to Rs. 30 lakhs depending on features and brand. Showrooms are expanding too, with many companies looking for spaces with at least 2000 sq ft. in metropolitan cities. These launches demonstrate the industry’s dynamism in catering to the evolving needs of the Indian consumer.
normalised: Industry analysts are noting a shift towards S U Vs and crossovers, reflecting a preference for larger vehicles capable of handling diverse terrains. Tata Motors recently showcased a concept for a micro-S U V in Pune, indicating future design direction. Prices for new vehicles range from rupee four lakhs to rupee thirty lakhs depending on features and brand. Showrooms are expanding too, with many companies looking for spaces with at least two thousand square feet in metropolitan cities. These launches demonstrate the industry’s dynamism in catering to the evolving needs of the Indian consumer.
